page.title: 17SHARPLAW FARM
page.content: This farm of over 200 acres is tenanted by Mr.& Mrs. Park,helped by Joyce,their daughter. They have 38 Herefords and 14 calves which are fed by pail,Herefords crossed with Friesians. In June 1985 there were 508 grey-faced ewes.Because of the wet weather many of the lambs have suffered from pneumonia.The clipping is now finished,done by a contractor. He does 70 in 1.5 hours.Altogether 708 lambs have been born and they will be kept for six months then sold at St.Boswells. Crops are grown mainly to feed the animals,15 acres of turnips,40 acres of barley,and 30 acres of hay. There are two Ford tractors and one International which has a loader.
